page.title: 04WEST TILBURY
page.content: { West Tilbury}is a small,old village.Its population has remained at about the same number for the past 200 years,although it is no longer self-sufficient.It has a Post Office/food shop and a pub. called "The King's Head" which stand either side of the{village green}with the{ road running alongside. The two farms date from medieval times and have both recently been renovated although keeping their origi nal styles.{Condovers,}which is the farm to the west of the church, has given land to be used as a Scout, Cub,Guide, and Brownie camp.The school was forced to close from lack of numbers.There is a thriving village hall and a flint-built church, St.James.The tower of this is now unsafe and only the small graveyard is in use.
